sandy lake and river banks from Senegal eastward to Ethiopia and southward to Cameroon and Kenya; also Egypt and Sudan
inland northwestern and western India and Sri Lanka eastward to central Myanmar, central Thailand, Cambodia, and southern Vietnam
Senegal and Gambia eastward to Ethiopia, southward to far northern Angola, Democratic Republic of the Congo, and Sudan; formerly also Nile River, Egypt
breeds inland salt lakes of southwestern and south-central Australia; non-breeders reach southern Australia (including Tasmania)

breeds locally southern and central Europe eastward to northeastern Russia and China southward through Middle East to northwestern India; also eastern and southern Africa; winters to coastal northern Africa, inland western Africa, Indian Peninsula including Sri Lanka, and to eastern China
southern and central Australia (except Tasmania)
southern Canada to central Mexico; winters southern USA to Costa Rica and Cuba
Andes of southern Peru to northern Chile and northwestern Argentina

breeds from southern Europe, and Cape Verde Islands, northern and sub-Saharan Africa, Socotra, and coastal Madagascar eastward to southeastern Russia, eastern China, south-central Japan, Taiwan, east-central Philippines, southward to northern Middle East, Sri Lanka, Malayan Peninsula, eastward to western Java; winters to Greater Sundas and Philippines
Philippines, Indonesian Archipelago, New Guinea region, Australia (including Tasmania), North, South, Stewart, and Chatham islands (New Zealand), and New Britain
MacKenzie Basin (central South Island, New Zealand); winters to North Island
montane rivers of western Tajikistan, southeastern Kazakhstan, northwestern Xinjiang and northeastern Afghanistan eastward through Himalayas and Tibetan Plateau to Hebei (northeastern China)
south-central Chile and Argentina to Cape Horn Archipelago and Falkland Islands
northern Peru to Tierra del Fuego and Falkland Islands; winters to Uruguay
western Aleutians to central Baja California and Los Coronados Islands
coasts of southern Africa (northern Namibia to eastern Cape Province)
formerly coasts of eastern Canary Islands; extinct, last reported 1950
coastal, in far southeastern Indonesia, southern New Guinea including Aru islands (off southwestern New Guinea), and coastal Australia (including Tasmania)
Chatham Islands (Chatham, Mangere, Rangatira, and Pitt)
coastal North, South, and Stewart islands and satellites (New Zealand)
breeds inland South Island (New Zealand); winters coastally to North Island
breeds inland low Arctic (mainly) to temperate zone from Greenland eastward to Taymyr Peninsula (north-central Russia); winters to inland and coastal southern Europe, northern Africa, and Middle East

breeds high Arctic to subarctic from northern Alaska eastward to northeastern Canada, and southward to north-central British Colombia; winters coastal southeastern Brazil and Argentina, and inland grassland, Paraguay to east-central Argentina

breeds Arctic and subarctic Russia from Yamal Peninsula eastward to Chukotskiy Peninsula and northern Kamchatka and Bering Sea coasts of western Alaska; winters to coastal Horn of Africa and Indian subcontinent eastward through Taiwan and Indonesian Archipelago throughout Australasia and Micronesia to eastern Polynesia; widely vagrant elsewhere

riverbanks and mudflats of lowlands to hills in tropical South America east of the Andes south to Paraguay, south-eastern Brazil, and (rarely) north-eastern Argentina; west of the Andes only in western Ecuador
high-elevation bogs of Andes from central Peru to central Chile and western Argentina
breeds inland south-central Chile, southern Argentina, and Falkland Islands; winters to coastal southern Peru and southeastern Brazil

breeds high Arctic coastal tundra and alpine zone, from northern British Isles and Scandinavia eastward to Chukotskiy Peninsula and western Alaska; in south locally from Pyrenees through montane Mongolia; winters from Iberian Peninsula and northern Africa eastward to Arabian Peninsula and Iraq

breeds inland high Arctic from Chukotskiy Peninsula (northeastern Russia) eastward through Aleutian Islands and across Canada to Newfoundland and Nova Scotia (southeastern Canada); winters coastally from Oregon and New Jersey southward to northern Chile and northern Argentina; also West Indies and Galápagos
coastal and inland southwestern Australia, and coastal south-central and southeastern Australia, including Tasmania
South East/Rangatira Island, Chatham Islands; formerly widespread in New Zealand evidently including Auckland Islands; reintroduced to northern New Zealand satellite islands
Australia including Tasmania (except southwestern deserts), and eastern New Zealand (where self-colonized in 1950s)
grassland and rocky hillsides of western and central Africa

breeds riverine temperate eastern Asia from southeastern Siberia and Japan through eastern China, and disjunctly northeastern India; winters central Nepal eastward to Korean Peninsula and Taiwan, and southward to central Vietnam

breeds inland temperate and subarctic Eurasia from Scandinavia and Iberian Peninsula eastward to southeastern Russia and northeastern China; winters northern Africa eastward to Japan, Taiwan, and northern Vietnam
inland west-central Angola to south-central Kenya and southward to South Africa
Senegambia to Red Sea, northeastern Tanzania, and eastern Mediterranean
rivers of India and Nepal to southwestern China and Indochina
southern Indus Valley of Pakistan, inland India eastward to central Assam, and Sri Lanka
sandy riverbanks of sub-Saharan Africa
savanna of sub-Saharan Africa
montane grassland of north-central to south-central Ethiopia

range poorly known; breeds from Nigeria east (probably) to northeastern Democratic Republic of the Congo; disperses west to Ghana, southward to Cameroon and southern Democratic Republic of the Congo, and eastward to western Tanzania

breeds inland northeastern China (Heilongjiang and Inner Mongolia), and central and southern Japan (Honshu to Kyushu); winters to southern and northeastern India, through southeastern Asia, Malayan Peninsula, Vietnam, and southeastern China
at least formerly Java; undocumented records from Sumatra and Timor; not reported since 1940 and likely extinct
inland and southern Australia including Tasmania

breeds inland northern Kazakhstan and adjacent southern Russia (formerly Ukraine to Xinjiang); winters Sudan to Eritrea, Israel, Arabian Peninsula, central Pakistan, and northwestern India (now rare globally)

breeds inland central Türkiye eastward to northwestern Afghanistan and southward from Persian Gulf to southwestern Pakistan; winters to Eritrea and Persian Gulf regions eastward to southwestern Pakistan
Andes of south-central Colombia to northern Chile and northwestern Argentina
Australia (except southwestern deserts and Tasmania)
inland central and southern Australia
breeds central Asia from southwestern Russia and Turkmenistan eastward to northwestern Xinjiang; winters inland Kenya to south-central Africa

breeds inland eastern Asia from south-central Siberia and Mongolia to western Inner Mongolia (north-central China); winters inland and coastal Indonesia from Java to southern New Guinea and northern Australia
breeds rivers of northern South Island; winters to coastal northern North Island (New Zealand)

coastal and riverine Neotropics from coastal Sinaloa and southern Tamaulipas (but not Yucatan Peninsula; Mexico), coastal Central America, inland around Lake Nicaragua and Panama Canal zone; northern Colombia and Venezuela including islands north of Venezuela, Trinidad, north-central Chile and central Argentina

breeds locally Great Plains of southwestern Canada to northeastern Utah and western Texas (southwestern USA); winters to inland central California, southern Arizona to southern Texas, and northern Baja California (northwestern Mexico)

breeds inland and coastal southeastern Chile, south-central and southeastern Argentina, locally in north-central Argentina and southeastern Brazil, also Falkland Islands; winters to coastal Chile and coastal southeastern Brazil
Andes of central Peru to northeastern Chile and northwestern Argentina
coastal western Madagascar
sub-Saharan Africa, northeastern Egypt, and Madagascar
St. Helena Island (southern Atlantic Ocean)
breeds Timor (eastern Lesser Sundas) and Australia including Tasmania; winters to eastern Java
coastal Malayan Peninsula to Philippines (local), Greater and Lesser Sundas, and Sulawesi region
coastal southern Sumatra, Java, Bali, Lesser Sundas, and southern Sulawesi
breeds coastal southeastern China; also Vietnam (1 nest); winters to coastal southern Vietnam, southern Thailand, Malay Peninsula, Singapore, and eastern Sumatra
locally in sparse grassland of inland southeastern Australia (southwestern Queensland to northern Victoria)
breeds high-montane southern Chile and west-central Argentina southward to Cape Horn; winters to plains of southeastern Argentina
locally in lowlands of Paraguay and southeastern Brazil to south-central Argentina and central Chile
locally in inland Africa, Madagascar, and Oriental region from Indus Valley (central Pakistan) to Japan, Philippines, and eastern Lesser Sundas
southeastern to northern Australia, mainly on coasts from southern South Australia (Eyre Peninsula) to northern Queensland

breeds northern Pakistan eastward in sub-Himalayan region to southeastern China and Taiwan, and southward to southern India, Sri Lanka, southeastern Asia, and Philippines; winters sparsely southward to Malayan Peninsula, Sumatra, Java, and Bali

inland southern Sinaloa and central Tamaulipas (northwestern and northeastern Mexico); rarely southern Texas (where formerly bred) to western Panama, and including Cozumel (just off Yucatan Peninsula); and Cuba, Jamaica, and Hispaniola
lakes, ponds, and marshes of sub-Saharan Africa from Mali eastward to Ethiopia and southward to Namibia and southeastern Africa
inland southeastern Borneo, Sulawesi, Lesser Sundas and Mindanao (southern Philippines) eastward to New Guinea and some satellites, and northern and eastern Australia
lowlands of India to southwestern China, southeastern Asia, Sumatra, and Java
lakes, ponds, and marshes of sub-Saharan Africa
lakes, ponds, and marshes of western and northern Madagascar

breeds inland grassland from southeastern Alaska eastward to southeastern Canada and New England, in south to eastern Oregon and Pennsylvania (USA); winters inland grassland from southern Paraguay, southern Brazil, Uruguay, and west-central to east-central Argentina

formerly bred low Arctic tundra of northwestern North America, from northern Northwest Territories (northwestern Canada; possibly also northern Alaska); wintered in grassland from southeastern Brazil, Uruguay, and northeastern Argentina; probably extinct, last confirmed record 1963

breeds patchily in subarctic taiga of west-central to east-central Siberia; winters coastal and inland south-central New Guinea, Port Moresby area (southeastern New Guinea), and northern Australia to west-central and east-central coasts

breeds upland low Arctic tundra of western Alaska, in north-central Seward Peninsula and northern Yukon Delta; winters from Micronesia and Fiji eastward through Northwestern Hawaiian Islands and Kaui (rarer on other main Hawaiian Islands), and throughout Polynesia

breeds inland grassland from southern British Columbia eastward to southwestern Saskatchewan (southwestern Canada) southward to northeastern California and northeastern New Mexico (southwestern USA); winters to coastal and inland California, and Gulf Coast to central Panama and western Yucatan Peninsula

breeds inland wetlands from east-central Siberia to Kamchatka and Ussuriland (southeastern Russia) and Heilongjiang (northeastern China); winters to Philippines, Indonesia, Australia, and New Zealand (scarce)
formerly bred southwestern Siberia; wintered to coastal Tunisia and Morocco; probably extinct, last verified report 2001

breeds patchily in low Arctic bogs near treeline, in western and south-central Alaska, northern and south-central Northwest Territories, and southwestern Hudson Bay (northwestern to east-central Canada); winters mainly to temperate coastal wetlands, where highly localized, in northern Peru to southern Chile and southern Brazil to southern Argentina

breeds inland wetlands from southwestern Siberia and eastern Kazakhstan, (probably) northern Mongolia to southeastern Siberia, and northeastern China; winters coastal southern Thailand, Malayan Peninsula, Indonesian Archipelago, and northern Australia

breeds wet meadows from Lena River through northeastern Siberia, St. Lawrence Island (Bering Sea; rare), western Alaska and northern Northwest Territories (north-central Canada); winters inland from the southern US through Mexico, along the Pacific coast from the Pacific Northwest south to northwestern Costa Rica, and along the Atlantic and Gulf coasts from the mid-Atlantic south to the Yucatan Peninsula

breeds taiga wetlands from Scandinavia and northeastern Poland to east-central Siberia; winters inland wetlands from Faroe and British islands, western and southern Europe, Mediterranean, tropical Africa, Middle East, and southern Asia

breeds temperate forest and edge from southwestern Alberta eastward to Maritime Provinces (south-central to southeastern Canada) and southward to southeastern Texas and northern Florida (southeastern USA); winters in southeastern USA

breeds locally in moist woodland and bogs from British Isles and Scandinavia southward to northern Iberian Peninsula and Azores to Canary Islands, eastward to southeastern Russia, and northern and central Japan, and disjunctly in the Caucasus and Himalayas; winters southward to northern Africa and eastward to central and southern Japan and Taiwan
Amami-O-Shima, Tokuno-Shima, Okinawa, Tokashiki-Shima (Ryukyu Islands, southern Japan)

cloud forest and clearings, from lowlands to mountains of Calayan and Babuyan (Babuyan Islands, northernmost Philippines), and montane Luzon and Mindanao (northern and southern Philippines, respectively)
mountains of Sumatra and western Java
mountains of New Guinea
Obi (north-central Moluccas)
formerly North Island (subfossils only); historically known only from Little Barrier Island (off northeastern North Island), New Zealand; extinct, last recorded 1870
formerly South and Stewart islands (subfossils only); historically known only from islands off Stewart Island (New Zealand); apparently extinct, last recorded 1964

Snares Islands (Northeast, Broughton, and Alert Stack), south of New Zealand; introduced to Codfish Island, off Stewart Island
elfin forest montane bogs from Ecuador to Peru (old records Colombia)
bogs of temperate central and southern Chile and southern Argentina to Cape Horn and Isla de los Estados (east of Tierra del Fuego)
montane bogs from west-central Venezuela to north-central Bolivia

breeds alpine meadows of western Himalayas from Himachal Pradesh to eastern India and south-central China; winters to lower-elevation wetlands and woodlands, rarely to Indian Peninsula and northern Southeast Asia
breeds meadows from northern Scandinavia and eastern Poland eastward to Yenisei River (western Siberia); winters wet grassland of tropical and subtropical sub-Saharan Africa

breeds wooded wetlands of south-central Siberia and northeastern Kazakhstan eastward to Amurland (southeastern Russia); winters wetland edge from east-central China, Taiwan, Philippines, and Malay Peninsula eastward through New Guinea, Melanesia, and Micronesia

breeds low Arctic tundra to temperate montane meadows from northwestern Siberia and northeastern Kazakhstan eastward to Sea of Okhotsk (eastern Siberia); winters inland wetlands from southern Arabian Peninsula eastward through southern Asia to Ryukyu Islands (southern Japan) and southward to Taiwan and Greater Sundas
breeds meadows and fields of eastern Amurland and southern Sakhalin (southeastern Russia) southward through Honshu (central Japan); winters freshwater wetlands of eastern Australia including Tasmania
marshes of eastern and central massif of Madagascar
breeds central Aleutian Islands to eastern Canada and northern tier of continental USA; winters south of breeding range to northern South America
montane wet grassland far western Venezuela to far northern Peru
wetlands from central Colombia and Trinidad through the Guianas southward to northern Argentina and Uruguay
breeds from central Chile and central Argentina southward to Tierra del Fuego and Falkland Islands; southernmost populations are migratory, nonbreeding distribution unclear but reaches Uruguay

breeds low Arctic tundra and taiga from Finland and Ukraine eastward to Chukotskiy Peninsula and southward to western Amurland (eastern Russia); winters mainly coastal mudflats and estuaries from eastern Africa eastward to Taiwan and northern Australia

breeds inland waterbody margins from British Isles and Scandinavia eastward to Chukotskiy Peninsula (northeastern Russia), in south from Iberian Peninsula across Caucasus to Kashmir (northwestern Himalayas), northeastern China, and Japan; winters from southwestern Europe and Africa eastward to Melanesia and Micronesia

breeds inland waterbody margins from Aleutian Islands and Alaska mainland except North Slope eastward through Canada (except far northern) to Newfoundland, and southward to southwestern and east-central USA; winters southern USA and Caribbean southward to northern Chile and Argentina

breeds inland marshes of western and central Canada to west-central USA; molt migration to hypersaline lakes of western Canada and USA; winters mainly saline montane lakes from Peru to Argentina; also western coast of South America from Ecuador southward, and Argentina to Tierra del Fuego

breeds mostly high Arctic marshy tundra from southern Greenland and Iceland eastward across Siberia to northern Alaska and northern Canada including southern tier of Arctic Canadian islands; winters off coasts from California to southern Chile, Atlantic USA to northern Florida, and off western Africa

breeds mostly low Arctic tundra from southern Greenland and Iceland eastward to Kamchatka, Kuril, and Commander islands, and Aleutians through Canada; winters off coasts of Indian Ocean from Arabian Sea eastward through Indonesian Archipelago and in Pacific to New Guinea and Bismarck Archipelago and western Mexico to Peru and Galapagos

breeds taiga wetlands from Scandinavia and Germany eastward to Sakha Republic (northeastern Siberia), southward through central Asia and northeastern China; winters wetlands from British Isles southward through Africa and eastward to Japan through Philippines

breeds montane tundra from Chukotka (northeastern Siberia) through Alaskan mainland (except far north) to northwestern Canada; winters mainly rocky Pacific coasts from eastern Australasia, Melanesia, Micronesia, Polynesia, isolated eastern Pacific islands, and southwestern Canada to Ecuador

breeds montane tundra of Krasnoyarsk (west-central Siberia) and Yana River eastward to Kamchatka (eastern Siberia); winters muddy to sandy Pacific coasts from Malay Peninsula eastward through Micronesia and western Polynesia and southward to northern Australia

breeds freshwater marshes from eastern Poland and Baltic states eastward through southern Russia and northern Kazakhstan to Amurland and northeastern China; winters wetlands from Africa eastward through southern Asia to southern Japan and Mariana Islands, and southward to Australia

breeds wooded wetlands from Scotland and Scandinavia eastward through inland northern Russia to eastern Siberia and northeastern China, in south through northern Mongolia to Commander Islands (southeastern Russia); winters small wetlands from Africa eastward to southern Japan and southward to Australia
breeds subarctic tundra to forest from Alaska mainland eastward to James Bay and probably central Quebec (east-central Canada); winters southern USA throughout Caribbean southward to Tierra del Fuego

breeds coastal larch forest of western and southern coastal Sea of Okhotsk, Tatar Strait (west of Sakhalin), and Sakhalin (eastern Siberia); winters coastal mudflats and saltpans of southeastern Bangladesh, southern Myanmar, southern Thailand, Malayan Peninsula, Sumatra, and southwestern Borneo

breeds wooded tundra from Scandinavia eastward through inland Russia to Chukotskiy Peninsula (northeastern Siberia); winters wetlands from southern British Isles and tropical Africa eastward through southern Asia to southeastern China and Taiwan

breeds taiga wetlands from Scotland and Scandinavia eastward through temperate Russia to far eastern Russia; winters from southern Europe and Africa eastward through southern Asia to central Japan and southward to Australia and western Micronesia

breeds taiga muskeg from southern Alaska eastward through southern tier of Canadian provinces to eastern Labrador (eastern Canada); winters wetlands of southern USA and throughout Caribbean southward to Tierra del Fuego
formerly Kiritimati (Christmas) Island (Line Islands); extinct, not reported since discovery in 1778
formerly Tahiti (Society Islands); extinct, not reported since discovery in 1773
formerly Moorea (Society Islands); extinct, not reported since discovery in 1777

breeds coastal and inland waterbodies of western Alaska; winters rocky coastal southeastern Alaska to southern Baja California, Gulf of California, and Sonora (northwestern Mexico)
breeds montane tundra of Alaska mainland (except far northern) and Yukon (northwestern Canada); winters rocky coasts from southeastern Alaska to Tierra del Fuego
breeds montane tundra of northeastern Siberia from Yakutsk eastward to Anadyr Peninsula; winters coasts from northeastern Arabian Peninsula eastward to Taiwan, Phillipines, and Australia

breeds tundra and steppe of northwestern Europe from Scandinavia southward to northern Ukraine and eastward to far eastern Siberia; winters from central Europe southward through Africa, eastward through southern Asia to central Japan southward to Philippines
breeds low Arctic tundra from Lena to Kolyma rivers (northeastern Siberia); winters from Wallacea eastward through Australasia; prone to extreme vagrancy

breeds drier tundra from Yamal Peninsula to northwestern Chukotskiy Peninsula (northwestern to northeastern Siberia), including New Siberian Islands; winters southern Europe and Africa eastward through southern Asia to Taiwan and Philippines and southward to Melanesia; prone to extreme vagrancy

breeds tundra to taiga edge of North Slope of Alaska eastward to north-central Canada; winters Mexico and throughout the Caribbean; in Central America mainly along Pacific coast; coastal South America to Peru and northern Brazil, and in pampas of north-central Argentina

breeds coastal tundra of eastern Chukotskiy Peninsula to northern Kamchatka (norhteastern Russia); winters coastal mudflats from Taiwan and east-central China to Bangladesh; mainly Thailand, Myanmar, and Bangladesh; rare and local

breeds coastal tundra of Taymyr Peninsula eastward to Chukotskiy Peninsula and northern Kamchatka Peninsula (north-central to north-eastern Siberia); breeds coastal northeastern India and Sri Lanka eastward to Philippines, Australasia, and Melanesia

breeds tundra of Scandinavia eastward through northern Russia to Chukotskiy Peninsula (notheastern Russia), including New Siberian Islands; winters southeastern Europe southward to central Africa and eastward to southern Japan and Taiwan

breeds subarctic to temperate bogs of disjunctly in Chukotskiy Peninsula, northern Kuril and Commander islands (eastern Russia) and (perhaps) northern Mongolia; winters eastern India and Sri Lanka eastward through southern Asia to southern Japan and southward to southeastern Australia

breeds high Arctic dry coastal tundra from Wrangel Island (northeastern Siberia) eastward through Alaskan North Slope to northeastern Canada, including Arctic islands from Banks to Devon; migrates to grassland of southeastern Brazil and Uruguay to central Argentina; prone to extreme vagrancy worldwide

breeds montane tundra from Greenland and Iceland eastward through Arctic Europe and Russia to Taymyr Peninsula (north-central Siberia), also Banks to southern Ellesmere and Baffin islands (north-central Canada); winters rocky North Atlantic coasts from Iceland and Faroe Islands to western Europe, and Labrador and Gulf of St. Lawrence (southeastern Canada) southward to North Carolina

breeds high Arctic dry tundra from Wrangel Island to eastern Chukotskiy Peninsula (northeastern Siberia) through northern and central Alaska, northern Canada including Arctic islands from Banks to Ellesmere and Baffin islands, and northwestern Greenland; winters in mountains and coastally from southern Peru through Chile and southern Argentina

breeds wet tundra from Yamal Peninsula eastward to Chukotskiy Peninsula (northwestern to eastern Siberia), including New Siberian and Wrangel islands, also western and northern Alaska eastward through northeastern Canada, including Arctic islands; winters wet grassland and wetland edge mainly to Peru, Bolivia, and southern Brazil southward to Tierra del Fuego; prone to extreme vagrancy

breeds tundra from eastern Chukotskiy Peninsula (northeastern Siberia) through northern Alaska and eastward in northern Canada to northern Labrador, including southern Canadian Arctic islands from Banks to Baffin; winters coasts from Isthmus of Tehuantepec and Yucatan Peninsula (southwestern Mexico) and Caribbean to far northern Chile and northeastern Brazil

breeds Chukotskiy Peninsula and Anadyr (northeastern Siberia; few), St. Lawrence Island (Bering Sea), and western and northern Alaska mainland; winters coastal Washington to Peru and Galapagos, southeastern Canada to Caribbean, and inland central Mexico to northern Costa Rica

breeds drier tundra from northern Scandinavia eastward through northern Russia to New Siberian Islands (east-central Siberia); winters mudflats and marshes from southern Europe and Africa eastward to southern Asia

breeds tundra and taiga wetlands from eastern Aleutian Is through Alaska and Canada eastward to Labrador and Nova Scotia; winters mudflats and wetlands from southeastern USA, Caribbean, and Mexico southward to northern South America

breeds wet tundra from North Slope of Alaska eastward in coastal northern Canada to northwestern Hudson Bay, and Banks to Devon and Baffin islands (northeastern Canada); winters to wetlands of southern Chile, southeastern Brazil, northwestern to southeastern Argentina, and Falkland Islands
discontinuously distributed Sahel of sub-Saharan Africa
grassland and woodland in Australia (except Tasmania)
savanna and scrub of northern, central and eastern Australia (Kimberley region, northern Western Australia, eastward to eastern South Australia)
Luzon (northern Philippines)

mountains of South Africa (southwestern Cape Province to Port Elizabeth)
northwestern Australia (Kimberley region, northern Northern Territory) and offshore islands

formerly New Caledonia; probably extinct, not reported with certainty since 1889
coastal eastern Australia (southeastern Queensland, and formerly northern New South Wales)
Madagascar; introduced (?) Mauritius, Réunion, and Glorieuses

open woodland of sub-Saharan Africa
tropical scrub jungle of Eastern Ghats of Andhra Pradesh (east-central India); extremely rare, no recent records

semidesert of southwestern Angola to Namibia, Botswana, and South Africa
breeds rocky coastal and river islets of northwestern and eastern Madagascar; winters coasts and estuaries of eastern Africa from southern Somalia to northern Mozambique

breeds northern Australia (Kimberley region, northern Western Australia, eastward to inland eastern Australia and southward to northern Victoria); winters south-eastern Indonesia to southern New Guinea
eastern Afghanistan and Pakistan to India and Indochina
rivers of Mali to Cameroon, western Democratic Republic of the Congo, and northwestern Angola

breeds patchily in grassland near water from western India and Sri Lanka eastward to southeastern Siberia and southward to Philippines; winters grassy fields of islands of northern Indian Ocean and Indian Peninsula eastward through northern Australia and western Micronesia
breeds saline steppe near water from central Ukraine and southwestern Russia eastward to eastern Kazakhstan; winters in grassland near water of eastern Namibia, Botswana, and northern South Africa

breeds mostly low Arctic tundra from Greenland, Iceland, and Scotland eastward to northeastern Siberia and Kamchatka, Aleutian and Bering Sea islands, through Alaska to east-central Arctic Canada (except northern high Arctic islands); winters to coastal waters of Africa, Persian Gulf, western India and Sri Lanka, eastward to Australasia, and Peru, Chile, and east-central Argentina

breeds high Arctic tundra, mainly northwestern to northeastern Russia (including many high Arctic islands), northern and southwestern Alaska, eastward through Arctic Canada to Baffin Island (northeastern Canada); winters to temperate to tropical coasts and offshore waters worldwide

breeds Iceland, Faroe Islands, Ireland, Scotland, Norway including Svalbard, and northwestern Russia to Novaya Zemlya; winters North Atlantic Ocean offshore waters to central Gulf Stream of New England to North Carolina, northeastern Brazil, North Sea to Iberian Peninsula, western Mediterranean, Macaronesia, and western Africa

breeds coastal Antarctica, especially Ross Sea; also South Shetland and South Orkney islands (off Antarctic Peninsula); winters to northern offshore waters and North Indian Ocean: mostly clockwise to Japanese and Korean waters and Gulf Stream of eastern USA, then southwestern Canada to northern Baja California and northwestern Africa
breeds coasts of southern Chile and southern Argentina; ranges north to coasts of southern Peru and central Brazil

breeds North Pacific islands from Sakhalin and Kuril Islands, Hokkaido and northern Honshu (northern Japan), Aleutian Islands, southern Alaska to southern California; winters coastal waters to southern Japan and Korean Peninsula and northern Baja California

breeds North Pacific coasts and islands from northern Chukotka and Sea of Okhotsk through Kuril and Commander islands (eastern Russia), off southeastern Hokkaido (northern Japan), eastward through Bering Sea and Aleutian Islands and southern Alaska southward to central California; winters offshore in North Pacific Ocean, and nearshore to southern Japan and southern California

breeds North Atlantic coasts from Greenland, Iceland and Faroes eastward through Scandinavia including Svalbard, and Novaya Zemlya (northwestern Russia), also northern Hudson Bay to southeastern Canada and Maine (northeastern USA); winters offshore in North Atlantic and marginal seas, to North Carolina Gulf Stream and to Azores and Iberian Peninsula

breeds North Pacific coasts and islands from Wrangel Island eastward to Kamchatka, Kuril, and Commander islands (northeastern Russia), through Bering Sea and Aleutian islands and patchily in western and southern Alaska southward to British Columbia; winters offshore and coastally in North Pacific Ocean, mostly in breeding range

breeds North Pacific coasts and islands patchily from eastern Chukotka to Kuril and Commander islands (eastern Russia) eastward through Bering Sea and Aleutian islands; winters offshore in North Pacific, to northern Sea of Japan and western British Columbia (southwestern Canada)
sedentary, North Pacific coasts and islands patchily from Sea of Okhotsk, Kuril, and Commander islands (eastern Russia) and Aleutian Islands

breeds North Pacific coasts and islands, patchily from eastern Chukotka, Sakhalin, Kuril, and Commander islands (eastern Russia), Bering Sea and Aleutian islands; winters offshore to Hokkaido and northern Honshu (northern Japan) and Gulf of Alaska

breeds North Pacific coasts and islands, patchily from eastern Chukotka, Sakhalin, Kuril, and Commander islands (eastern Russia), Bering Sea and Aleutian islands, and Gulf of Alaska; winters offshore in North Pacific, reaching northern Sea of Japan and western British Columbia (southwestern Canada)

breeds western North Pacific coasts and islands from off western Honshu, Kyushu, and Izu Is. (central and southern Japan), south of Korean Peninsula, and perhaps far southeastern Russia; winters Hokkaido to southeastern Japan

breeds Cedros, San Benito, and Asuncion-San Jorge islands (west-central Baja California), islands in Gulf of California, including Rasa, and Tiburon, and Partida; winters to coastal central California and Jalisco (west-central Mexico)
breeds Guadalupe and San Benito islands (central Baja California, northwestern Mexico); winters offshore northward to coastal northern California
breeds Channel Islands (southern California) and islands off northwestern Baja California to San Benito (northwestern Mexico); winters offshore north of coastal Washington

breeds coastal strip up to 30 km inland in Kamchatka, Sea of Okhotsk, Sakhalin (eastern Russia), and northern Hokkaido (northern Japan); winters to coastal central Japan; prone to long-distance vagrancy to continental USA
breeds coastal strip up to 100 km inland from Aleutian Islands to central California; winters to coastal southern California

breeds coastal strip up to 75 km inland, patchily from Wrangel Island, Chukotka, northeastern Kamchatka, and northern Sea of Okhotsk (eastern Russia), eastward to Bering Sea and Aleutian islands and southeastern Alaska; winters bays and fjords in breeding range

breeds North Pacific coast from Sea of Okhotsk, southern Kamchatka, Sakhalin, Kuril Islands (eastern Russia), Hokkaido (northern Japan), and perhaps northeastern Korean Peninsula; winters to central Japan and southern Korean Peninsula
bred eastern Canada, Greenland, Iceland, Faroe Islands, British Isles, and Denmark; wintered to eastern USA and Mediterranean; extinct, last reported 1844
breeds major rivers and lakes of tropical Africa; non-breeders also on coasts
breeds very locally on major rivers, now mainly north-central and east-central India and central Myanmar; winters to coast of northwestern Indian Peninsula and Bay of Bengal
Fernando de Noronha, Trindade, Martin Vas Rocks, Ascension, and St. Helena islands (tropical South Atlantic Ocean)
Marquesas, and Phoenix and Line islands

breeds North Pacific coasts from Sakhalin, Sea of Okhotsk, and Kamchatka (eastern Russia) eastward through Aleutian Islands and to southwestern Alaska; winters coastal Thailand and Philippines eastward to New Guinea and east-central Australia; migrates along w North Pacific coast via Japan southward toTaiwan
breeds islets of tropical Pacific from Marianas and Samoa eastward to main Hawaiian Islands; ranges to northeastern Melanesia and far eastern Polynesia
breeds coastal Namibia to Cape Province; winters to northern Angola
breeds large rivers from northern Colombia eastward to Guianas and southward to northeastern Peru and east-central Argentina; non-breeders concentrate mainly on coast and estuaries
breeds patchily on arid Humboldt Current coasts of central Ecuador southward to northern Chile; winters coastally in same region
breeds Red Sea and Persian Gulf to islands between India and Sri Lanka; apparently winters mainly Seychelles to Maldives and Cocos (Keeling) Islands
widespread on rivers and lakes east of Andes to north-central Argentina

breeds patchily coastal Baltic Sea and inland southeast Europe to western Mongolia and Ussuriland (southeastern Russia) and northeastern China and southern Asian coasts; coastal and inland western and southern Africa; Europa (west of southern Madagascar, Mozambique Channel), coastal Madagascar and Aldabra group (southwestern Seychelles); coastal and inland northern and eastern Australia, coastal New Zealand (North, South and Stewart islands); inland Northwest Territories to northeastern Canada, in south to central California and Great Lakes; winters to coastal Africa, Red Sea, Persian Gulf, India, Thailand, Malay Peninsula, and Vietnam; eastern Pacific and Caribbean to Panama
breeds Australia (except arid areas); ranges to coastal southern New Guinea and Timor (eastern Lesser Sundas)
breeds islands off northern Peru to central Chile; ranges rarely northward to Ecuador
breeds braided riverbeds of South Island; ranges to coastal North and Stewart islands (New Zealand)

breeds inland south-central and eastern Europe eastward to north-central Siberia and northeastern China; winters Africa eastward to Philippines, Australia (except western deserts and Tasmania), and New Zealand

breeds islands off southwestern California and Baja California and Gulf of California (northwestern Mexico); post-breeding dispersal to coastal northern California, and wintering southward along Pacific coast to central Chile

breeds very locally islets off coastal eastern China and southwestern South Korea; winter range poorly known but mainly coastal southeastern China, Taiwan, northern Philippines, and coastal Seram (southern Moluccas); very rare

breeds coastal southern California and Gulf of California to Sinaloa and Islas Tres Marias, and Atlantic from Virginia southward to Florida, Gulf of Mexico to s Texas, and Caribbean including peripheral islands southeastward to French Guiana, and disjunctly coastal southern Brazil, Uruguay, and east-central Argentina
breeds coastal Mauritania to Guinea; winters to Morocco and Namibia
rivers of Indus Valley (Pakistan), sub-Himalayan India, northwestern and central Myanmar, southwestern China, and southeastern Cambodia (formerly also southern Vietnam)

breeds inland central Alberta eastward to central Manitoba (south-central Canada) patchily southward to northern Baja California (northwestern Mexico), Colorado, and the Great Lakes, also North Atlantic coast from New Jersey to North Carolina, and Gulf coast southward to northern Tamaulipas (northeastern Mexico); winters to Gulf coast, Bahamas, Cuba, and southern Mexico
coastal lagoons and marshes of coastal Aconcagua to Llanquihue provinces (central Chile) and southeastern Brazil and Uruguay to inland east-central Argentina

breeds circumpolarly, Arctic coasts and inland, from Greenland, Iceland, and British Isles eastward to Kamchatka (eastern Russia), through Aleutian Islands, Alaska mainland through Arctic and subarctic Canada to southeastern Canada; winters subantarctic and Antarctic Ocean to edge of pack-ice
coasts and islands of southern South America and Falkland Islands
coastal Kenya to Persian Gulf, Red Sea, and coastal Pakistan
breeds coastal New Zealand, including Chatham and Auckland islands, also Furneaux group in Bass Strait; winters to southeastern Australia including Tasmania
inland Indus Valley (Pakistan), sub-Himalayan India and Irrawaddy River (central Myanmar); formerly to southern China and Vietnam
breeds Galapagos and Malpelo Island (far west of Colombia); winters to Humboldt Current off Ecuador to northern Chile

breeds Baltic region eastward to Sea of Okhotsk and southward to northern Kazakhstan and northeastern China, also rarely Great Lakes, Hudson and James bays (east-central Canada); winters North Atlantic coasts and North, Mediterranean, Baltic, Black, and Caspian seas

breeds western and eastern Greenland (rare), Arctic northeastern Siberia, locally from Taimyr Peninsula to Kolyma River, Arctic northeastern Canada and formerly Churchill, Manitoba (west-central Hudson Bay, east-central Canada); winters Arctic Ocean, in Beaufort (north of Alaska) and Labrador seas (at least)
breeds Commander Islands (southeastern Russia), Aleutian, and Pribilof islands, and St. Matthew Island (northern Bering Sea); winters Bering Sea to ice-edge and south of Aleutian Islands

breeds patchily on Arctic coasts of Greenland, Svalbard, and Siberia eastward to Chukotka Peninsula, St. Lawrence Island, western and northern Alaska, and Arctic Canada; winters coastal and offshore waters of northern South America to northern Chile and western Africa from Angola to southern Africa

breeds high Arctic islands from Greenland, Svalbard, Franz Josef Land eastward to Herald Island (northeastern Russia) and northern Canada; winters Arctic Ocean pack-ice edge to southeastern Labrador, Greenland, and Bering seas
breeds Yellow Sea coasts from Liaoning to Jiangsu (eastern China) and Songdo (northwestern South Korea); winters coasts of East China Sea from Japan and Korean Peninsula to northern Vietnam

breeds patchily on coasts and saline lakes from southern Iberian Peninsula to Central Asia, Pakistan, and coastal far northwestern India, also Mauritania and Senegambia; winters to coasts of Arabian Peninsula and western India

breeds boreal forest zone from southwestern Alaska mainland across Canada to eastern Quebec (southeastern Canada); winters eastern North Pacific coast southward to west-central Mexico, inland southeastern USA, western North Atlantic coast and offshore Gulf Stream southward to the Bahamas and Cuba

breeds southern Greenland, Iceland, and western Europe eastward across Russia to Yakutsk region (eastern Russia), southward through Caspian Seato northeastern China, also west-central Newfoundland (southeastern Canada); winters to Africa, southern Asia, and eastern North America

breeds inland Tibetan Plateau of Tajikistan, Xinjiang (western China), Ladakh (far northwestern India), and Tibet; winters inland and coastal Indian Subcontinent, southwestern China, and western southeast Asia
coastal southwestern Namibia to southwestern South Africa
breeds inland and coastal southeastern Brazil, central Chile and Argentina southward through Tierra del Fuego, and Falkland Islands; some winter coastally farther north
breeds Andean lakes of far southwestern Colombia to south-central Chile and southwestern Argentina; some non-breeders move to adjacent Pacific coast
breeds mostly gravel riverbeds in South Island (New Zealand); winters to varied habitats of southern North Island
breeds coasts of southern Chile, Argentina, and Falkland Islands; some move north on coasts
breeds inland nitrate desert of Chile and at least formerly Peru; ranges to coastal Ecuador

breeds prairie marshes of western and northern Alberta eastward to southwestern Manitoba, and southward from east-central Oregon to northwestern Minnesota; winters coasts from Ecuador (including Galapagos) to central Chile
Galapagos coasts

breeds patchily on lake islands from Crimea eastward through Kazakhstan and Mongolia to Gansu, Qinghai, and Inner Mongolia (west-central China); winters to coasts, landlocked seas, and rivers from Black Sea eastward across Bay of Bengal to Bangladesh and south-central Myanmar

breeds lakes of northeastern Kazakhstan eastward to Transbaikalia (southeastern Russia) and Inner Mongolia (northeastern China); winters coasts of Korean Peninsula, Bohai Bay, Yellow Sea, and East China Sea
breeds coastal southern Portugal and Spain through Mediterranean and associated seas eastward to Cyprus and southern Türkiye; winters southward to coast of Gambia

breeds inland southern Britain and eastern Spain eastward to southwestern Russia, Ukraine, and Azerbaijan; winters coasts southern Ireland to west-central Africa, Black Sea, and Mediterranean and associated seas
breeds islands of Red Sea and associated gulfs; winters through Red Sea and nearby coasts
breeds islands of Red Sea, Gulf of Aden, Socotra, southward to northern Kenya and eastward to southern Pakistan; winters to central Tanzania including Zanzibar
western coast and islets of Humboldt Current of northern Peru to northern Chile; disperses to northern Ecuador and central Chile

breeds coasts and islets of eastern Siberia to Kuril Islands (southeastern Russia), Hokkaido and Honshu (northern and central Japan), Korean Peninsula, eastern China, and Matsu Island (off Taiwan); winters to southward, some reaching southern Vietnam and Philippines
breeds coastal southern Buenos Aires and Chubut provinces (east-central Argentina); some winter to coasts of southeastern Brazil
coastal western Mexico; winters British Columbia to Guatemala

breeds inland British Columbia eastward to Labrador and Newfoundland (eastern Canada), Pacific Northwest states, and Great Lakes (northern USA); winters to coastal and inland southern USA, southern Mexico, Bahamas, and Greater Antilles

breeds Alaska mainland eastward to northwestern Alberta and southward to southwestern British Columbia (southwestern Canada); winters Pacific coast from southern British Columbia southward to northwestern Baja California (northwestern Mexico)
breeds islets in Gulf of California, from Roca Consag to La Paz Bay; winters to Salton Sea (southern California) and throughout Gulf of California (northwestern Mexico)

breeds inland southern Poland and Hungary eastward through Black, Caspian, and Aral seas to eastern Kazakhstan; winters southeastern Europe, Black Sea, eastern Mediterranean, Persian Gulf, and northern Arabian Sea

breeds northern and western Alaska eastward across subarctic Canada to Baffin Island and Newfoundland, southward on Pacific coast to southern British Columbia, eastward to inland northeastern USA and Atlantic coast southward to North Carolina; winters from Aleutian Islands southward on Pacific coast to Nayarit (western Mexico), Gulf coast, and inland to Honduras and northern Caribbean

breeds Arctic central and eastern Siberia from Taymyr eastward to Chukotka, New Siberian Islands, and St. Lawrence Island (Bering Sea); winters mostly to rocky coasts of Japan, Korean Peninsula, and eastern China

breeds Altai Republic to Lake Baikal (south-central Russia) and Mongolia, Lake Khanka (Heilongjiang, northeastern China), and Yellow Sea islands (western Korean Peninsula); winters mostly to coastal wetlands of Japan, Korean Peninsula, eastern China, and Taiwan
breeds lakes of Caucasus to eastern Türkiye and northwestern Iran; winters to eastern Mediterranean, southern Black and Caspian seas, and Persian Gulf

breeds North Atlantic coasts, from southern Greenland and Iceland to Svalbard and Baltic states, and coastal and inland northeastern Canada to Great Lakes and Atlantic coast southward to New Jersey; winters to coastal southwestern Europe and coastal Florida

breeds coastal North Pacific from eastern Siberia, Kamchatka, Kuril and Commander islands (eastern Russia) eastward through Aleutian and Pribilof islands, and southwestern Alaska to northern Washington; winters to Japan and northwestern Mexico

breeds coasts and lakes of northeastern Siberia including Kamchatka southward to Kuril Islands (eastern Russia), and eastward to Hokkaido and northern Honshu (northern Japan); winters to coasts of Japan, Korean Peninsula, Bohai Sea (northeastern China), and Taiwan; prone to extreme vagrancy
patchily in montane forest of Grande Terre (New Caledonia)

breeds across the northern Holarctic region; winters coastally in the north Pacific Ocean from the Kamchatka Peninsula to the Yellow Sea, and from southern Alaska to northwestern Mexico; and in the northern Atlantic Ocean from the Maritime Provinces (Canada) to the southeastern USA, from Scandinavia south to the Mediterranean, and the Black and Caspian seas

breeds in southern Greenland, Iceland, and northern North America southward to northern tier of US states; winters from Iceland and Scandinavia southward to the Iberian Peninsula and from southern Alaska and the Maritime Provinces (Canada) southward to northern Mexico

breeds Arctic northwestern Russia from Novaya Zemlya eastward to Chukotka Peninsula, through northern Alaska and northern Canada to Nunavut (east-central Canada); winters to northern Norway, Japan and Korean Peninsula, and coastal British Columbia (southwestern Canada); prone to extreme vagrancy
breeds coastal eastern Siberia and northern North America eastward through northern Canada to Baffin Island and James Bay (eastern Canada); winters to Japan and southern Baja California

breeds on beaches of subantarctic islands, in Tierra del Fuego, Falkland Islands, South Georgia, South Sandwich Islands, Prince Edward, Crozet, Kerguelen, and Heard islands, and Macquarie Island (southeast of Australia); disperses widely at sea mostly around Antarctic Convergence
breeds in scattered colonies on Antarctic continent edge and up to 200 km from open sea; ranges Antarctic seas to edge of ice pack and beyond, juveniles dispersing most widely
breeds circumpolarly along coastline of Antarctica and associated islands; winters near edge of ice pack
breeds on Antarctic Peninsula and associated islands, including Balleny Island (eastern Antarctica); winters mostly south of Antarctic Convergence, to southern South America and subantarctic islands
breeds coastal southern Namibia and southern South Africa; ranges to central Namibia and southeastern Africa
Humboldt Current region of coastal northern Peru to central Chile
coastal western Galapagos (Fernandina and Isabela)
breeds coastal central Chile and central Argentina to Cape Horn and Falkland Islands; winters to southeastern Brazil
very local on coasts of South (where now very rare), Stewart and satellites, Auckland, and Campbell islands (New Zealand)
breeds inland in forests of southwestern South Island, western and southern Stewart Island, and satellites (New Zealand); winters to seas south of Australia
breeds among rocks of Bounty and Antipodes islands (New Zealand); winters to waters of eastern South Island
subantarctic islands in South Atlantic Ocean and southern Indian Ocean
breeds on coastal slopes of Macquarie and nearby Bishop and Clerk islands (southeast of Australia); winters mostly near colonies, with juveniles ranging farther
breeds far southern Chilean islands of Magallanes Province to Cape Horn Archipelago and Falkland Islands; winters northward along Patagonian coast
breeds coastally on Prince Edward, Crozet, Kerguelen, Heard (southern Indian Ocean), Macquarie (southeast of Australia), and Auckland, Campbell, and Antipodes islands (New Zealand)
breeds among coastal rocks and tussocks of Tristan da Cunha group and Gough (South Atlantic), and St. Paul and Amsterdam islands (South Indian Ocean)
breeds coastal forest of Snares Islands; disperses westward to waters off southeastern Australia, and northward off New Zealand
breeds Española (Galapagos) and Isla La Plata off Ecuador; ranges to coastal waters of Ecuador and northern Peru
breeds western Hawaiian and Revillagigedo islands; ranges North Pacific
breeds western Hawaiian Islands, and Izu, Bonin, and southern Ryukyu islands (southern Japan); ranges North Pacific from Bering Sea to Tropic of Cancer
breeds Torishima (Izu Islands) and Senkaku Islands; ranges through North Pacific
breeds mostly Sisters and Forty Fours (Chatham Islands), also Otago Peninsula of southeastern South Island (New Zealand); ranges all southern temperate and subantarctic oceans, mostly Pacific
breeds Enderby Island (Auckland Islands) and Campbell Islands (New Zealand); ranges all south temperate and subantarctic oceans
breeds high-latitude islands of South Georgia, Prince Edward, Crozet, Heard, Kerguelen, and Macquarie islands; ranges all southern oceans
breeds Inaccessible and Gough islands (Tristan da Cunha group); ranges subtropical and temperate southern Atlantic Ocean
breeds Amsterdam Island (French subantarctic islands); ranges mainly south Indian Ocean
breeds circumpolar subantarctic islands; ranges through subantarctic and Antarctic oceans
breeds temperate zone islands of South Atlantic and south Indian oceans; ranges through temperate zone of those oceans
breeds Tristan da Cunha and Gough islands; ranges southern oceans
breeds on southern Indian Ocean islands; ranges mainly southern Indian Ocean between Tropic of Capricorn and Subtropical Convergence
breeds circumpolar high southern latitudes; ranges southern oceans mostly south of South Polar Front
breeds mostly Bounty Islands, a few in Snares and Crozet islands; ranges to temperate and subtropical waters off southeastern Australia, western South America, and southern Africa
breeds Pyramid Rock (Chatham Islands); ranges in Humboldt and Magellanic currents off southern Peru and Chile
known only from waters near Chiloé Island (Reloncavi Sound and the Chacao Channel), Chile
now breeds on predator-free islands mainly in Line, Marquesas, Gambier, Austral, and Easter Island groups, formerly much more widespread, including westward to New Caledonia, Vanuatu, Fiji, and Samoa

breeds circumpolar subantarctic islands in Falklands, South Georgia, Gough (Atlantic), Crozet and Kerguelen (Indian Ocean), Macquarie (few; Australia), Chatham, Antipodes, and Auckland (New Zealand); ranges mainly between Antarctic and Subantarctic convergences, north to southern Tasman Sea and about 35°S
breeds Little Barrier Island (northern North Island, New Zealand); ranges to seas off southeastern Australia and Fiji
breeds New Caledonia; ranges from the Coral Sea eastward to Samoa and the Marquesas
breeds in winter on Cape Verde Islands; present all year around Cape Verde Islands, and extent of at-sea range unknown, possibly to eastern North America

breeds in Atlantic Ocean on Macaronesian and Berlengas islands of western Atlantic, islets near St. Helena and Ascension islands, in Pacific off central Japan, Kauai, and the Galapagos; ranges in Atlantic to Gulf Stream, Gulf of Mexico, western Africa and Gulf of Guinea, in North Pacific, seas off Japan, near main Hawaiian Islands, and coasts of southern Central America to northwestern South America and westward to Marquesas
breeds in summer on Azores; present Azores mainly April-August, and extent of at-sea range unknown, possibly to eastern North America

breeds islands off California and Baja California, including Gulf of California, from Channel Islands southward to Islas de San Benito (off central Baja California); ranges coastal waters northward to central California and southward to northern Peru

breeds off Paracas Peninsula (southern Peru) and Atacama Desert to mountains 50 km inland between Arica and Iquique (northern Chile); ranges east-central Pacific to coasts of southern Mexico, Galápagos, and central Chile
breeds Islas San Benito (central Baja California) and islands in Gulf of California; ranges coastal waters from southern California to Ecuador
breeds Atacama Desert, mostly in mountains well inland (northern Chile); ranges Humboldt Current of southern Ecuador to north-central Chile

breeds islands off California and northern Baja California, from Mendocino County (northwestern California) patchily southward to Isla Todos Santos (northwestern Baja California); ranges coastal California Current to northern California (including Monterey Bay) and north-central Baja California
breeds Izu, Bonin, and formerly Volcano Islands (southern Japan), and Northwestern Hawaiian Islands; ranges eastern coastal waters of Japan and eastward to Kauai (Hawaii)

breeds mainly islands off Japan, also islets off southeastern Russia, Korean Peninsula, eastern China, and Taiwan; ranges through eastern Indonesian Archipelago to southern India and Sri Lanka, Arabian Sea, and off northeastern African coast; recent records from Atlantic Ocean and Mediterranean

breeds Volcano Islands (far southern Japan); disperses westward to Arabian Sea, Seychelles, and off eastern African coast, eastward to western Micronesia, seas of eastern Indonesia, and off northwestern Australia
formerly bred Guadalupe Island (Mexico); probably extinct, last reported 1912
summer breeder on islets off Guadalupe Island (western Mexico); ranges in eastern Pacific north to southern California and southward to ca. 10°N
winter breeder on islets off Guadalupe Island (western Mexico); nonbreeding range poorly known, but apparently disperses southward in eastern Pacific, at least as far as the Galapagos
breeds Antarctic islets, coasts and mountains to 350 km inland; ranges Southern Ocean mostly near ice, south of Antarctic Convergence

breeds islands and coasts of Antarctica to Heard (Indian Ocean) and Macquarie islands (Australia), and off southern Chile and Argentina; ranges coasts and open water of all southern oceans and cold currents, often south of Antarctic Convergence

breeds islands north of Antarctic Convergence from South Georgia to Macquarie (southeast of Australia) and Stewart, Chatham, Antipodes, Auckland, and Campbell islands (New Zealand); ranges coasts and open water of all southern oceans, mostly north of Antarctic Convergence
circumpolar in Antarctic, breeding islets and coast of Antarctica; ranges southern oceans from pack-ice to Humboldt Current off Chile and Peru
formerly St. Helena Island (South Atlantic); extinct

breeds Azores to Cape Verde Islands, Round Island (off Mauritius), Bonin Islands (southern Japan), islands off southern China, Kiribati, Marquesas, Northwestern and main Hawaiian islands, including Johnson Atoll; ranges widely in Atlantic, reaching western Africa, widely in tropical Indian Ocean from Mascarenes eastward to New Guinea and northern Australia, and through tropical Pacific

breeds Socotra (Yemen) and Halaaniyat islands (Oman); ranges mainly northwestern Indian Ocean, including gulfs of Aden and Oman, off eastern Africa to waters of Seychelles and Mascarenes, eastward to western India and off northwestern Australia
probably breeds Gau Island (central Fiji); distribution at sea unknown but recorded in Fiji waters
breeds montane Réunion (Mascarenes); formerly also Rodrigues, where extirpated; ranges adjacent Indian Ocean to Seychelles, Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Timor Sea (off western Australia)

likely breeds montane southern New Ireland (Bismarck Archipelago); ranges eastern Bismarck Archipelago, widely in Solomon Islands, and Vanuatu; also recorded Cenderawasih Bay (northern New Guinea) and north-central Moluccas
breeds coastal foothills of western South Island (New Zealand); ranges to southeastern Australian waters and Humboldt Current from northern Chile southward to Cape Horn

breeds islets of south temperate and subantarctic oceans from Inaccessible and Gough (Atlantic) to Macquarie Island (southeast of Australia), Campbell and Antipodes islands (south of New Zealand); ranges circumpolar subantarctic waters

breeds islets of south temperate and subantarctic oceans north of Antarctic Convergence from Falkland Islands to southern outlying islands of New Zealand; ranges widely in southern oceans, to southern coasts of southern continents and subantarctic islands
breeds Inaccessible Island (Tristan da Cunha); ranges to coast of southern Brazil to northern Argentina, and to southwestern Africa
breeds Little and Great Barrier islands (off North Island, New Zealand); ranges to southeastern offshore Australian waters and east-central Pacific off Mexico southward to Ecuador

breeds coastal islands from Russian Far East, Korean Peninsula, and Japan to islands off western Taiwan; ranges western Pacific to Philippines, Indonesia, and northern Australia eastward through Melanesia to Micronesia
breeds Cape Verde Islands; ranges mainly in upwelling systems of tropical and South Atlantic
breeds Mediterranean islands and southwestern France; ranges mainly in upwelling systems of tropical eastern Atlantic

eastern Atlantic, breeding from Azores southward to Canary Islands and eastward to Galicia (northwestern Spain) and Berlengas Islands (off west-central Portugal); ranges widely in Atlantic, but mainly in upwelling systems of the Benguela and Agulhas currents

widespread in tropical and subtropical Pacific and Indian oceans, breeding on islets from Seychelles and Mascarenes eastward through Ogasawara and Iwo islands (southern Japan) and northern Australia, thence to Hawaii and Revillagigedo Islands (off central Mexico); ranges from northeastern Africa and Malagasy region eastward to southern Baja California and southward to Panama

breeds Poor Knights Islands (off northern North Island, New Zealand); wide trans-Pacific dispersal northward to the Aleutian Islands, also eastern Australia and western South American waters to central Chile
breeds islets off southern Australia, including Bass Strait and Tasmania; ranges to Antarctic ice edge waters, then to Sea of Okhotsk, Bering Sea (North Pacific Ocean)

breeds southeastern Australia (including Macquarie Island), New Zealand including associated subantarctic island groups, far southern South America (including the Falkland Islands), and Tristan da Cunha (south Atlantic Ocean); winters northward in North Atlantic to Greenland and northwestern Europe, and in northern Pacific to Gulf of Alaska and western USA

breeds Tristan da Cunha group (mainly) and Kidney Island (Falkland Islands; few); ranges in Atlantic off southern South America and southern Africa, and northward to southern Greenland and northwestern Europe

breeds islets off St. Paul (central Indian Ocean), southern Australia, Lord Howe Island (east of Australia), North Island and Cook Strait (New Zealand); ranges to Arabian Sea, eastern Malagasy region, and Sea of Okhotsk to Gulf of Alaska and western USA coast (rare)
breeds Juan Fernández and Mocha islands off central Chile; ranges inshore and coastal eastern Pacific Ocean waters northward to Gulf of Alaska and southward to southern Chile

breeds eastern Polynesian island groups, in Hawaii, Line, Austral, Marquesas, Gambier, Pitcairn, Easter, and Salas y Gomez; ranges westward to Micronesia and eastward to coasts of western Mexico southward to Costa Rica
breeds islets off larger Galapagos Islands; ranges to waters off west-central Mexico and Central America
breeds islets of northeastern North Island and Marlborough Sounds (northeastern South Island, New Zealand); ranges to Australian waters
breeds montane northeastern South Island (New Zealand); ranges to seas off western, southern, and eastern Australia

breeds Azores, Madeira including Desertas and Salvage islands, and Canary islands; ranges (rarely) to coasts of southwestern Europe and northwestern Africa, and near shelf-slope break off New England (northeastern USA)
breeds Cape Verde Islands; ranges (rarely) to Canary Islands, northwestern African coastal waters and Amazon Reef (northeastern South America)
presumably breeds montane Bougainville, Kolombangara, and Rendova (northern and west-central Solomon Islands); non-breeders range westward to Flores, Moluccan seas, and Bismarck Archipelago

breeds Tristan da Cunha and Gough (Atlantic), and Chatham and Antipodes islands (New Zealand); ranges in South Atlantic to Falkland Islands and southwestern Africa, and widely in South Pacific from southern New Zealand to south-central Chilean coast
breeds Higashi-jima (northern Bonin Islands, far se Japan); ranges southern Japanese waters but originally discovered on Midway Island (Hawaii)
breeds islands off western coast of Baja California and northern Gulf of Mexico; ranges to central California inshore waters, Gulf of California, and inshore waters of west-central Mexico
breeds Bonin and Volcano islands (far southern Japan); ranges in Japanese waters
breeds Rapa Island (Austral Islands); non-breeding range unknown
breeds mountains of Revillagigedo Islands (off western Mexico); ranges to coastal waters from southern Baja California to Oaxaca (western Mexico)

breeds mountains of main Hawaiian Islands (primarily Kauai, also Molokai, Maui, and Hawaii); ranges to waters south of Japan and Mariana Islands and to southwestern Pacific near New Caledonia, Solomon Islands, and Vanuatu
breeds islets of Humboldt Current zone from Lobos de Tierra (off northern Peru) to Coronel (Bio-Bio region, south-central Chile)
breeds islets in Chilean fjords to Cape Horn; ranges coasts and fjords northward to south-central Chile and coastal Santa Cruz (southeastern Argentina)

breeds islands of subantarctic Atlantic and Indian oceans mostly south of Antarctic Convergence from Diego Ramírez (south of Tierra del Fuego), Cape Horn, and South Georgia through subantarctic islands of southern Indian Ocean to Macquarie Island (southeast of Australia); forages to Antarctic waters; disperses to waters of southern South America and southern Australia
breeds islands off New Zealand and Tristan da Cunha group; disperses southern oceans
breeds Prince Edward and Crozet islands; ranges to southern Indian Ocean and southern Australasian seas
breeds in the southern Atlantic Ocean (Gough Island) and the southern Indian Ocean (off St. Paul Island, formerly also Amsterdam Island); at-sea distribution not well known

breeds islets of subantarctic to Antarctic oceans (mainly south of Antarctic Convergence), from Antarctic Peninsula to north of Ross Sea, Macquarie (Australia), and Auckland Islands; ranges from pack-ice to waters off southern South America, Africa, and Australasia
breeds Crozet, Kerguelen, Noir (off southern Chile), and Falkland islands; ranges southern oceans to Humboldt Current of western South America, off coast to southern Brazil, and southern Australasia
breeds South Georgia, Gough, Inaccessible, Prince Edward, Crozet, and Kerguelen islands; ranges subantarctic and Antarctic waters north of pack-ice

breeds subtropical to subantarctic islands of South Indian and South Atlantic oceans, from Tristan da Cunha and Gough to Maatsuyker (off Tasmania), Macquarie Island (southeast of Australia), and Antipodes Islands (south of New Zealand); ranges to southern waters off Australasia, Africa, and South America
breeds only in forest of southern Chatham Island; ranges to Pitcairn group, Juan Fernandez and Nazca Ridge off South America; rare, population about 200
breeds Gough and (at least formerly) Tristan da Cunha; ranges to deep offshore waters of southern Brazil to Argentina, and southwestern Africa

breeds on headlands and islands off northern North Island (New Zealand), especially Moutohora Island and Hongiora Island (Bay of Plenty); non-breeding range in deep subtropical water from Tasman Sea (off southeastern Australia) to southern Melanesian waters (southwestern Pacific Ocean)
breeds subantarctic islands of South Indian and South Pacific oceans, from Crozet to Antipodes and Auckland islands; ranges to southern waters off South America, Africa, Australasia, and Antarctica

breeds on subtropical to temperate islands from Tristan da Cunha and Gough (south-central South Atlantic Ocean) to Kerguelen Island (southern Indian Ocean), and Eclipse and Coffin islands (off southwestern Australia); non-breeding range in subtropical to temperate South Atlantic and southern Indian oceans from east of southern South America to southern Australian waters

breeds montane Hispaniola ("Black-faced") and Dominica ("White-faced"), perhaps also southeastern Cuba and northeastern Jamaica; extinct as a breeder Guadeloupe; ranges to Gulf Stream off southern Canada to North Carolina and throughout Caribbean
formerly bred montane eastern Jamaica; probably extinct ca. 1936
breeds Nonsuch Island (Bermuda); disperses to Gulf Stream

breeds in summer in cliffs high on Pico do Arieiro (central Madeira; central Macaronesia); non-breeding range in subtropical and tropical Atlantic to Azores (northwestern Macaronesia) and St. Helena and northeastern Brazil (tropical South Atlantic Ocean)
formerly bred on St. Helena Island; extinct
winter breeder mainly in rock crevices in montane Santo Antão, São Nicolau, Fogo, and Santiago (Cabo Verde Islands, southern Macaronesia); non-breeding range probably mostly off northwestern Africa

summer breeder in burrows on Bugio (Desertas Islands, just southeast of Madeira, central Macaronesia); non-breeding range probably mostly to Azores (northwestern Macaronesia) and southeastern Brazil, more rarely to Gulf Stream off eastern North America and western Europe
breeds Volcano, Bonin, and western Hawaiian islands; ranges to Sakhalin and central Japan
breeds Juan Fernández, San Ambrosio, and San Félix islands (off Chile); ranges to coastal waters of southern Peru to central Chile and to Pitcairn group
breeds Alejandro Selkirk Island (off Chile); ranges eastern and North Pacific

breeds Great and Little Barrier islands (off northeastern North Island) and Codfish Island (off Stewart Island, New Zealand); ranges to Tasman Sea, off southeastern Australia and northeastward to Aleutian Islands to Chile
breeds small islands off northern North Island (New Zealand), and formerly Norfolk Island (east of Australia); ranges to North Pacific

breeds Cabbage Tree and Boondelbah islands (off southeastern Australia) and montane Grande Terre, New Caledonia; ranges to Tasman Sea (east of Australia), Antarctica, and tropical Pacific to Hawaiian and Galapagos islands
breeds Rangatira Island (Chatham Islands); non-breeders range to Nazca Ridge west of Peru and Chile; rare

breeds Round Island (southwestern Indian Ocean), southwestern Pacific from Lord Howe and Phillip Island of the Norfolk group (east of Australia), islets off New Caledonia, islets off North Island (New Zealand), and Chatham Islands (east of New Zealand) eastward through Austral Islands; ranges to waters off southeastern Australia and Pacific Ocean southeast of Japan eastward to northwestern Mexico and southward to Peru
breeds montane Alejandro Selkirk Island (=Mas Afuera, Juan Fernández Islands; far off central Chile); ranges to tropical Pacific around main Hawaiian Islands
breeds montane Galapagos; ranges to waters off western Mexico to Ecuador
breeds montane Réunion; ranges tropical Indian Ocean mostly south of the Equator, off Madagascar, and to Arabian Sea and northwestern Australian waters
breeds montane Kaua'i, Moloka'i (formerly), Lana'i, Maui and Hawaii; ranges to Gulf of Alaska and offshore waters from Oregon to California
breeds mostly Lord Howe Island and (few) Philip Island of Norfolk group (east of Australia); ranges to eastern Australia and northwestern Pacific off Kamchatka and Japan, eastward to Bering Sea
